details.access_and_opening_times:
Opening hours

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm

Consular section

Telephone enquiries

  • Monday to Friday, 10am to midday
  • Telephone: (+372) 667 4700

Visits

By appointment only during the following times:

  • Monday to Thursday, 10am to midday and 1:30pm to 3pm

Appointments should be made at least 24 hours in advance, preferably by email to TallinnConsular.Enquiries@fco.gov.uk or by telephone during the enquiries time.

Closed Saturday and Sunday

Visa section

This Embassy does not deal with visa matters. For information on whether you need a visa to travel to the United Kingdom and how to apply, please see the UK Visas & Immigration page.

  • 27 December

Getting to the embassy

Our office is located on Wismari 6, not far from the National Library (Rahvusraamatukogu) and Kaarli church (Kaarli kirik). Find us on the map

By Taxi

Tallinn has thousands of taxis. Taxis can be ordered by the phone or hailed on the street. The average starting fee is from 2 to 3 EUR, and price for 1 km is from 0,50 to 1 EUR.

By Public transport

Bus number 40

  • exit on Tõnismägi bus stop, if coming from city centre
  • exit on A. Adamsoni bus stop, if coming from Mustamäe

Trolley number 1

  • exit on Tõnismägi bus stop, if coming from city centre
  • exit on A. Adamsoni bus stop, if coming from Mustamäe

Tallinn public transportation planner is available here

Bus, trolley and tram tickets can be purchased at newsstands for 1 EUR (single ticket) or from the driver for 1,60 EUR. You can also buy a 10 ticket package for 8 EUR.

There are also hourly and daily tickets available (can only be purchased from the newsstand and not from the driver). There are special electronic devices (located at the first and second door of the vehicle) available in each bus, to validate such tickets, which will print the time and the date.

Ticket must be validated right after entering the bus, trolley or tram and kept till the end of journey.

Parking

We are sorry but there is no public parking space at the embassy. The nearest available parking is on the corner of Wismari and Toompuiestee - please note, that this is a paid parking area.

Security

Due to the global threat currently posed by terrorism, and the targeting of embassies, we do our utmost to ensure a safe and secure environment for your visit.

Please co-operate with the security team as they conduct their checks and controls, each of which should take only a few minutes. The security measures in place are for the benefit of all visitors and staff.

Visitors to our office will have to go through the security checkpoint at the entrance. Mobile phones and electronic devices are not allowed into the building.
